piping tips are quite big so you're
gonna have to cut off a good amount off
the end of your bag and then if you want
multiple colors in the one flower the
trick to doing that is to spread some
buttercream on to some plastic wrap in a
rectangle coming close to the edge on
one side only the side that's facing you
but leave a good gap on all the other
edges then add a different color over
the top but don't go to the edges on the
side you just want it to go down a strip
down the middle and then add a third
color for the center of your flower into
the middle of that fold that over and
wrap it up and then twist the top end
then holding on to that end lift it up
and place the other end into your piping
bag and then twist the top now when you
start piping you need to remember to
hold the tip low to your cake so the
edges and the center can detach see here
the edges in the center of touch down so
it works and you get the pattern of the
flower on your cupcake if you hold the
piping tip too high the outside petals
will join to the cake but the inside
will not attach as you can see there so
then it's not going to work the other
thing to keep in mind is how tall you
pipe your flowers if you only squeeze
out a little bit of frosting you end up
with like a bit of a blob if you do a
medium amount all the way through too
tall it gives you quite a nice flower it
looks good at the different levels it
has a bit of a different look so it
depends on what you like but if you do
